items.content:
Remote | International
  • Marketing
  • Remote job

Job description

ShortPoint is looking for a creative and passionate Digital Marketing Executive to join our Marketing team.

In this position, you will have the opportunity to develop your skills by working closely alongside the Marketing Manager to execute successful digital marketing campaigns. You will be responsible for creating engaging content, developing and managing digital marketing campaigns across all social channels and overseeing pay per click ad management. In addition, you will assist with the management of the SEO strategy, Email Marketing, and will be an expert on Google Adwords. You will stay up to date with the latest trends within digital marketing, and will provide valuable data insights to help develop the marketing strategy and forecast budgets to ensure the successful implementation of all campaigns.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop engaging online content including social media posts, newsletters, and blogs; monitor and analyze content success.
  • Performing activities relating to Search Engine Optimization on a continuous basis.
  • Creating and executing email marketing campaigns.

What We Offer:

  • Flexibility in vacations;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Working remotely;
  • Team building and activities & Annual meetups with the whole team
  • Fitness activities expenses covered;
  • Very dynamic culture and a friendly, helpful team.

Requirements

  • 3+ years experience in Social Media, SEO or PPC
  • 3+ years of experience in content marketing
  • BSc/BA in marketing or relevant field
  • WordPress experience is a plus
Apply for job

items.title: Digital Marketing Specialist
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States

Making the invisible visible. By harnessing the power of artificial intelligence, and smart medical device development, we’re advancing the practice of medicine for doctors and society. And we’re just getting warmed up.

The Opportunity:

AliveCor seeks a Digital Marketing Specialist to join the exciting start-up that is changing the face of mobile health. The Digital Marketing Specialist is responsible for setting up, optimizing and reporting on digital advertising campaigns for AliveCor. This includes managing, optimizing and reporting on paid search, social media, email marketing and digital advertising campaigns. The ideal candidate will have experience with Google Ads, Facebook Ads, Amazon Ads/Amazon Seller-Support and Mailchimp. The candidate will have an interest in data and analytics with a willingness to learn and optimize all advertising platform.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage and optimize all digital advertising campaigns to achieve the highest potential conversions
  • Test new advertising targeting strategies and tactics
  • Manage the email marketing lists and collection
  • Work with Amazon Support as listing issues arise
  • Work with Google Ads to ensure paid search and display is optimized and driving conversions
  • Report updated digital metrics to the Marketing Manager

Skills & Experience:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Advertising, Marketing or equivalent experience
  • 2+ years’ experience with managing digital advertising campaigns in Google Ads and Facebook Ads
  • A certification in Google Ads, Facebook Ads or both
  • Familiarity with the Amazon Seller platform
  • Experience with Google Analytics
  • Basic understanding of impressions, CTR, CPM, Reach and Frequency
  • Strong data analysis skills

Location:

This position can be based remotely. We want the best candidate and will not let geography get in our way.

The Perks:

AliveCor is located in downtown Mountain View, CA. We are close to Caltrain and supply car and bike parking for employees. We strive to make your life outside work as smooth as possible while you’re at work, and we offer a long list of benefits to make that happen.

  • Competitive salary and competitive stock options
  • Flexible and generous vacation policy
  • Maternity / Paternity Leave
  • 401(k) matching
  • Employee 100% covered for medical, dental and vision
  • Mobile reimbursement
  • Stocked kitchen + weekly catered lunches
  • A supportive, collaborative group of people who understand that success depends on the team
Apply for job

items.title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
tags: DBG:surround``remot 3N OR(options, avail, allow) NOT encourag
items.content:
Remote

Location: United States

Job description

Ylopo, LLC is a rapidly growing marketing and technology company providing internet marketing services and proprietary lead generation and engagement software to successful real estate teams across the country. With over 1,000 real estate teams on our platforms, we’re generating 1MM+ leads annually. We love self-described “digital marketing nerds” who love marketing strategy, data and execution. At Ylopo, you will have the opportunity to collaborate with a team of talented digital marketers and engineers who love building ad technology.

We are seeking a well-organized, tech-savvy Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our marketing team. In this role, you will be the liaison between our digital marketing department and our clients. The role entails rolling up your sleeves to understand client issues; problem-solve with team members with the ultimate goal of improving our client performance and overall ROI.

The ideal candidate has experience in a client service or account management background with the demonstrated ability to communicate, diagnose and problem solve with both clients & team members. This is a great opportunity for someone who has an account management background to transition into a career in digital marketing. We will teach the right candidate from the ground up how to leverage sophisticated digital marketing platforms across search engine marketing, social media marketing, analytics and much more! We are looking to fill a full-time position, and the right candidate will have the opportunity to grow within the company.

Example Responsibilities:

  • Communicate with clients to understand and troubleshoot issues with their marketing accounts
  • Work with marketing team members to optimize individual client accounts
  • Setup of marketing campaigns on Google Adwords and Facebook Editor
  • Create of reports related to marketing activities primarily on excel
  • Coordinate marketing activities between the client support team and marketing
  • Create and post advertisements from templates (Facebook, AdWords, etc.)
  • Complete data entry for CRM system and spreadsheets
  • Update and maintain records and run regular reports from multiple data systems
  • Collaborate across sales, marketing, and technical teams on various projects as they arise

Position Qualifications:

  • Excellent communication & account management skills
  • The idea of have daily consultative conversations with clients is exciting to you
  • Working knowledge of online marketing (SEM, SEO, Social Ads) preferred but not necessary
  • Intermediate and above level of excel knowledge preferred (ex. Know how to create a pivot table, use vlookup’s, etc.)
  • Must be extremely organized and detail-oriented
  • Ability to quickly learn new processes and procedures
  • Ability to effectively prioritize projects and workloads
  • Strong problem-solving skills
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

The person in this role would:

  • Set up, optimize and maintain multiple PPC campaigns in AdWords and Bing for clients nationwide.
  • Spend considerable time analyzing data and building reports via Excel with ability to build Access databases and queries in MYSQL a major plus
  • Experience in using bid optimization platforms would be helpful (we primarily use Optimizer)
  • Conduct competitor research where appropriate.
  • Communicate with internal sales staff and fellow marketing team members.
  • Analyze website traffic across multiple channels in-order-to recommend changes or make optimizations.
  • Make recommendations to both the size, scale, and effectiveness of your advertising efforts to both sales staff and current and potential clients.
  • Stay up to date with the latest PPC trends, tools, and best practices and take that information and communicate with other agency staff and clients.
  • Analyze what marketing channels (Search, Shopping, Display, etc) would be most effective at meeting client goals.
  • Compile and complete weekly and monthly reports and communicate results to both clients and/or account managers.
  • Communicate with clients about all Google properties, including Paid Search, SEO, Google Maps and how they relate to each other.

Qualifications …

  • Minimum of 1-3 years Paid Search experience managing multiple clients, agency level experience preferred.
  • On a team with experience managing scaled SEM campaigns ($100K+ monthly budgets preferred)
  • Advanced Excel skills
  • Experience with Google Analytics & Tag Manager a plus
  • Experience in Access and MYSQL a plus

Salary Range:

  • $45-$55K DOB

Job Type:

  • Full-Time

Location:

  • Full time remote is available nationally (US only), for those close to our offices in Santa Monica, CA or Phoenix, AZ we have flexible office hours based on training and collaboration needs.
Apply for job

Enjoy the freedom of working for yourself, and leave the marketing and admin work to ASSURANCE.

items.title: REMOTE CERNER PATHNET ANALYST
items.content:
CTG is seeking a Cerner Laboratory Systems Analyst for a remote opportunity, supporting the PathNet module.

Job responsibilities will include:

Provide application support services for Cerner PathNet

Analyze service requests, and make recommendations related to best practices

Follow client’s documented Demand Management process to obtain approval for changes.

Build application changes in Test, work with user to complete testing, and move to production according to the client’s change control process.

Provide support for projects and other special application initiatives

Troubleshoot complex user errors and provide timely and high quality customer service

Document issues and solutions

Participate in the day to day tracking and follow-up on issues and questions of daily operations.

Validate and support system testing efforts

Work with client users and functional teams as needed

Escalate issues to the vendor as needed, and monitor vendor tickets for resolution

Utilize the ticket management system to track issue status and work volume

Participate in a 24/7 after hours on call rotation

After an initial Knowledge Transfer period of 2 to 4 weeks at the client site, work will be performed remotely.

5+ years’ experience in support and build of Cerner PathNet

Excellent troubleshooting skills, with the ability to communicate resolutions to customers

Prefer prior experience working remotely to provide production support

In depth knowledge of Laboratory workflows required; Med Tech or other clinical experience

These are Tier 3 positions – analysts should have strong build and troubleshooting expertise in the Cerner module identified

Experience in multiple Cerner modules is highly preferred

Please apply online or for immediate consideration, please send your resume to Holly.Christian@CTG.com

CTG (NASDAQ: CTG) has developed a reputation for responsiveness and reliability - traits that our clients say set us apart - since our founding in 1966. Today, we provide comprehensive information, technology, and business solutions that address critical challenges for clients in high-growth industries in North America and Western Europe. Backed by a proven track record of reliable delivery, CTG fosters long-term client relationships and trust, which allows us to develop strategic insights that maximize client investments and competitive advantage. CTG has operations in North America, Western Europe, and India and regularly posts news and other important information online at www.ctg.com.

Our culture is a direct result of the people who work at CTG, the values we hold, and the actions we take. In other words, our people are the culture. It's a living, breathing thing that is renewed every day through the ways we engage with each other, our clients, and our communities. Part of our mission is to cultivate a workplace that attracts and develops the best people, reflected by our recognition as a Great Place to Work-certified company across many of our global operations.

CTG will consider for employment all qualified applicants including those with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of all applicable local, state, and federal laws.

CTG is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. CTG will assure equal opportunity and consideration to all applicants and employees in recruitment, selection, placement, training, benefits, compensation, promotion, transfer, and release of individuals without regard to race, creed, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, age, disability, marital or veteran status, citizenship status, or any other discriminatory factors as required by law. Our Affirmative Action program serves to promote occupational equality and diversity through good faith efforts. CTG is fully committed to promoting employment opportunities for members of protected classes.

Additional Information

Job Function: Healthcare & Hospital Implementations

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree (±16 years)

Work Remote: Yes

Travel: No

items.title: Freelance Creative Cold Emailer - Remote Position
items.content:
Cardwell Beach is looking for a qualified cold outreach specialist to join our fast-growing marketing company.

We allow our team to work when, where and how they want. We're a great environment for digital nomads, work-from-home parents and night owls.

Day-to-day

This position focuses on sending emails to set meetings with new clients. Some responsibilities include:

  • Write customized/personalized cold emails to target prospects
  • Support the sales team with follow-ups and specialized correspondence
  • Set appointments with interested prospects
  • Sit in on qualifying phone calls with prospects, sales reps, and CB's Chief Marketing Officer

To Apply, Please Follow These Instructions:

- Review our website. Take some time to learn who we are, what are values are, and what our work looks like.

- Then, write us a cold email, pitching us on your abilities & qualifications. Don't be afraid to get creative. Really creative. We get many applications, and those selected are people who can differentiate themselves from the pack.

- Now create two more emails, this time writing them to your companies of choice. For example, pretend you're pitching Coca-Cola as a Cardwell Beach representative. Or, pretend you're offering marketing services to Hilton Hotels, or Captain Morgan. Get crazy with it.

- Don't actually send these emails to any reps at other companies, this is a creative writing exercise.

- Send us all three letters in the body of one email to CreativeEmailer@CardwellBeach.com

- Send your resume, too.

- So that's three cold emails total, plus a resume in the body of one email sent to us. Bear in mind that it is your unique voice, more than your qualifications, that will get you this job.

- Please apply ONLY by sending your email as instructed to the email provided - please do not apply through other means

Qualifications

  • Strong creative writer
  • Positive personality and open-minded
  • Interest in a career in sales writing
  • Desire to learn and grow at a rapid pace
  • Willingness to explore a variety of industries through writing and research
  • Extremely organized (keeping track of dozens of conversations each week isn't easy)
  • Strong understanding of technology: Gmail plugins, Mail Merge, Yesware familiarity a plus
  • Extra points for cold calling/cold emailing experience or formal sales training
  • Ability to handle freedom: you will work remotely, and as long as you are hitting your goals, you can work anywhere in the world with WiFi

items.title: Topflight Apps: Growth Marketer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Growth Marketer

Topflight Apps is a product design and development firm whose mission is to create digital app solutions that solve the hardest problems in healthcare, fintech, and machine learning.  Last year we became a 7-digit company, and this year in spite of the pandemic we are expecting to continue growing by 50-75%. 

We are a team of 25+ individuals, led by senior creatives and developers based across the United States.  Here is our Culture Statement: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1KEpEOoXcGgCLRlC-wh8Gis-QZ6l2zUw-

Together, we build web and mobile apps that solve our clients' problems in the most multidisciplinary and innovative ways possible. We expect everyone on our team that touches each project to bring elite craftsmanship and become a trusted partner that helps them make product decisions that lead to business growth.

Our COO runs our product team (making sure things get built to quality, on time and on budget), and our founder-CEO splits his time between marketing and sales. We are looking for a full-time growth marketer to take over all marketing operations.  

Our current marketing efforts are not lacking expertise, but they are fragmented.  Here is a breakdown of what we currently do:
  • Weekly technical blogs (topflightapps.com/ideas)
  • On-page and off-page SEO  
  • Project case studies (topflightapps.com/portfolio)
  • Marketplace proposals 
  • Social media promotion of new content 
  • Linkedin B2B Outreach 
  • Google CPC 
  • Facebook Retargeting Ads 

What we’re looking for from you is to take each of the fragmented efforts and unify them into consistent communication of our brand’s differentiators, then amplification of that message to our ideal target audience.  

Your responsibilities will include: 
  • Create one page Company Profile /  Business Profile 
  • Create Overview PPT deck 
  • Figure out our true brand, value, purpose we provide to clients in present and future  
  • Create stronger, polished proposal templates
  • Reach new audiences (enterprise, conventions, strategic partnerships) that represent expanded LTV
  • Managing copywriting across all channels that reflects our brand and advantages
  • Manage email campaigns to support releases, promotions, and special initiatives
  • Collaborate with Topflight’s internal design team and oversee the development of key art, video, and other creative assets
  • Plan and execute CPC campaigns and spend 
  • Create, execute, and monitor content strategies for all social media channels 
  • Be the face and voice of Topflight on webinars and podcasts
  • Work with the CEO for down-the-road raising of funds for runway expansion, governance, leadership, and strategic partners in key verticals
  • Use sales call recordings and participation in key closing sales calls to inform blog topic creation that is most relevant to our ideal customer
  • Own KPIs: monthly deal quantity, average deal value, cost of customer acquisition to deal value ratio  

Required Experience: 
  • Previous experience as a growth marketer, CMO, marketing manager, or founder with evidence of KPIs directly attributable to your role
  • Strong understanding of SEO, SEM, analytics, sales funnels, cost analysis of multi-channel customer acquisition. 
  • Leadership of a fully or partially remote team

items.title: Managing Director, Communications
items.content:
Remote | High-paying

Location: Oakland, CA or remote

Vote Solar is a non-profit policy advocacy organization with the mission of making solar more accessible and affordable across the United States. We work at the state-level in more than 25 states to drive the transition to a just 100% clean energy future. We are in search of a Managing Director, Communications to lead communications strategies that support organization growth and solar policy progress nationwide.

Reporting to the Executive Director, this position will serve as part of the Senior Leadership team, supervise the Communications team, and work in close collaboration with the Development team, Campaign team and Access & Equity team to meet communications needs across the organization.

This position can be based anywhere in the United States with a preference (but not requirement) for being based at Vote Solar’s headquarters in Oakland, California.

Requirements

Areas of Responsibility:

Organizational Strategy & Internal Culture:

  • Owns the strategic direction, goals, and growth of Vote Solars Communications department, including earned media, social media/digital engagement, and digital advocacy.
  • Infuses communications strategy, including commitments to equity and access, into organizational and campaign planning from the ground up.
  • Effectively supervises and supports staff on the Communications team, in alignment with Vote Solars internal culture goals.
  • Coordinates learning and the integration of new tactics, technology, and best campaign practices into Vote Solars communications strategies.
  • Engages in ongoing personal learning and contributions to organizational work on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Justice (DEIJ).

Organizational Communications:

  • Advances Vote Solars thought leadership.
  • Ensures the integrity of Vote Solars brand across communications channels.
  • Owns a collaborative process of setting annual organization-wide communications goals.
  • Develops and oversees implementation of plans for communicating with key national audiences, including members, funders and partners through both traditional and digital channels.
  • Provides messaging guidance and other communications guidance to enable Vote Solar staff to be strong spokespeople for the organization.

Campaign Communications:

  • Works with internal and external stakeholders to identify priority campaigns for external communications.
  • Develops and oversees implementation of effective communications plans — including content creation — for policy advocacy campaigns, spanning a range of paid and earned traditional media, digital channels, and online activism strategies.
  • Develops and implements plans to grow size and increase engagement of digital membership lists.
  • Defines success and supports the Communications team in achieving DEIJ and partnership goals in each priority campaign.
  • Uses data, testing and learning to increase the advocacy efficacy of Vote Solar and our partners.

Fundraising Communications:

  • Collaborates with the Development team and Executive Director to develop messaging and content that supports fundraising needs.
  • Supports digital and data needs of the Development team, particularly as it relates to website content, online donor appeals, event promotion, and list analytics.
  • Collaborates on key performance indicators and provides reports to the Development team on communications activities, as required by funders.

The successful candidate must have the following qualifications:

  • Experience developing and implementing multi-channel communications activities for diverse audiences.
  • Strong management skills with an ability to help the team set goals, define roles, and prioritize work.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ideally with experience creating inspiring and informative content for both technical and general consumer audiences.
  • Strong time management skills with the ability to plan, organize and prioritize a heavy workload and handle several tasks simultaneously.
  • Ability to manage work effectively across teams in multiple locations and build collaborative partnerships across lines of difference.
  • Ability to learn and communicate about energy policy and the policymaking process.

Bonus points for:

  • Prior work experience involving solar or other energy policy concepts, policy advocacy and/or political campaigns.
  • Experience with digital grassroots organizing, email marketing and/or database management.
  • Success in applying data from tools such as polling, digital tests, and surveys to inform communications strategy.
  • Commitment to racial equity and social justice and familiarity with the ways that race and other identities intersect and play out in our work.

Benefits

Vote Solar provides full-time staff with a competitive package, including 3 weeks of paid vacation in year one and 4 weeks starting in year two, 12 days of sick leave and 4 days of personal leave. We also offer 100% employer-provided health, dental and vision care for both the employee and dependents as well as a retirement savings plan and an employer match of up to 3.5% and paid parental and medical leave to full-time staff who have worked for Vote Solar for at least one year. Salary range is $120,000 – $140,000, commensurate with experience.

Vote Solar is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We strongly encourage and seek applications from women, people of color, including bilingual and bicultural individuals, as well as members of the lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender communities. Applicants shall not be discriminated against because of race, religion, sex, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, political aliation, sexual orientation, gender identity, color, marital status, or medical conditions. Reasonable accommodations will be made so that qualied disabled applicants may participate in the application process. Please advise in writing of special needs at the time of application.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior CEE Digital Marketing Manager
items.content:
Remote
  • Location: US-Remote
  • Position Type: Regular Full-Time

Sunrun is the nation’s leading home solar, battery storage, and energy services company. Our mission is to confront our planet’s biggest challenge, climate change, by creating a planet run by the sun. This mission requires passion, determination and a diverse growing army of talented professionals. Explore joining our mission by connecting with Sunrun’s Talent Network or submitting an application to this job today.

Overview

Sunrun is looking for a creative, analytical, collaborative digital marketer to join our team. This position will be responsible for driving efficient customer acquisition at scale across paid social, content marketing and display advertising. A successful candidate will have a strong, independent work ethic and experience driving growth and conversion through full-funnel consumer marketing tactics including the creation, implementation and ongoing optimization of digital marketing campaigns.

Responsibilities

  • Develop, launch and manage digital marketing channels (including Facebook, Taboola, LiveIntent, Google Display Network) with a focus on driving positive, incremental return on ad spend and new customer acquisition
  • Design and implement robust test frameworks that measure the incremental impact of channel focused digital marketing on leads, opportunities and revenue
  • Develop strong vendor partnerships to shape new opportunities that can enhance Sunrun’s ability to meet revenue goals (e.g. participate in beta tests with publisher partners or new bidding platforms)
  • Monitor, analyze, and share channel & campaign results and best practices within Sunrun
  • Formulate and execute end-to-end creative and landing page tests with the goal of driving personalization, relevance, and improved engagement
  • Drive continued optimization of new & existing campaigns
  • Partner with key stakeholders across the business to define objectives, develop/execute strategies and ensure a consistent customer experience across all channels
  • Communicate effectively with management, operations and sales staff as needed
  • Deliver results from a remote work environment

Qualifications

  • 3-5 years of digital marketing experience with working knowledge in paid social, display advertising and content marketing
  • Bachelor’s and/or graduate degree
  • Proven track record of defining and delivering innovative marketing campaigns and managing projects that drive long-term results
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, with an ability to distill complex ideas into easily understandable stories
  • Highly organized and detail-oriented, with ability to juggle competing priorities within tight timeframes
  • Exhibits intense curiosity, proactively digging beneath the superficial to identify relevant, information-based facts
  • Strategic and highly analytical
  • Experience with analytics & reporting tools
  • Strong knowledge of SEO trends and best practices preferred
Apply for job

items.content:
ObieCRE (YC S19) | Product Engineer & Our First Designer | Chicago | Full-time | REMOTE currently, ideally ONSITE eventually

We're looking for our 1st designer and engineer #4 to help build our product, our team, and our company. A small pivot has led to great product-market fit, and we now have acres of green field that need designing & coding.

How we make money: If you own a building that leases to office or commercial tenants, you need insurance. This is true if the economy is growing or crumbling. And as a result of this mandatory nature, it has not evolved to use modern technology. Workflows are manual. Communication is messy and time-consuming. People often don’t know what they’re buying or why. Obie sells commercial real estate insurance in a new way, once which emphasizes transparency and human-centric automation.

For the engineering role: our stack is Typescript, Node, GraphQL, and React. You should have ample experience in at least one of these technologies. Several years in overall coding experience is preferred, although the quality of this experience will be valued more highly than its duration.

For the design role: we're looking for someone who knows how to take a product from 0 to 1. Experience with phasing and sequencing of key features is highly desirable. A nice to is experience designing complex, B2B workflows.

To apply (or if you're just curious) please email careers@obiecre.com.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About Us:
Metis Labs is optimising the manufacturing of products that millions of households use every day.


We’re a London-based startup developing an AI software product - Kelvin - which allows factory operators to better understand how their manufacturing processes really work.  The result?  Less industrial waste, more energy efficiency.  


Considering the industrial sector uses ⅓ of the world’s natural resources, we believe this is a really important mission, and we are working with some of the world’s largest manufacturers to make it happen.


You can find out more about our product at www.metislabs.tech


Our team have developed a new and exciting AI product which creates optimised control algorithms that can improve the performance of certain industrial processes by a massive 10-times!


We have recently patented this technology and are now exploring different options to rapidly commercialise it.  


The Role:
This is a rare and exciting opportunity to contribute to the development of an AI product which improves the efficiency of real-world systems. You will be working remotely with a small team of very talented and driven individuals.  Together, we are working in close collaboration with our customers to create a unique product that has a big impact and which our users love.


We are looking for someone to help research and develop the commercialisation and go-to-market strategy.  You will be working alongside our CEO to research the market and explore partnerships with various other organisations. 


We are looking for someone who's are smart, comfortable with numbers and spreadsheets, and who can formulate ideas in a structured and logical way.  Ideally you may also have some experience estimating market sizes and/or  formulating go-to-market and commercial strategies.  


We are happy to consider candidates who may have been furloughed during this tough time and who want to use this time to learn and gain experience developing strategy to exploit AI technology with a startup which is entering an exciting growth stage.


The role is available to start as soon as possible and ideally we'd like someone who can spare at least 2-weeks to help support this project.  As you can imagine, the longer you are able to volunteer with us the more we'll be able to invest in your learning and experience.


Requirements:
- Competent with Microsoft Excel or similar (we use Google Sheets)
- Bachelor's degree or higher in a technical subject


Other Details
- You would be working remotely (our whole team are now remote) and you would need to have a computer and good internet connection.
- Expenses will be paid, if incurred.
- The main tools you'd be using are  Slack, Zoom, and GSuite (sheets, docs, slides etc)


We appreciate that applicants for this role may have excellent experience, talent and skills and would not normally be volunteering, were it not for this unfortunate COVID crisis.  Whilst furloughed volunteers can not legally be paid, we will endeavour to help out volunteers in any ways we can to make sure they get the learning, experience and references that they may be looking for from this experience. Just let us know and we'll try our best to help you out.


Our Culture and values:
Our team are passionate, smart and collaborative.
We believe in meritocracy. Everyone is encouraged to voice their ideas. 
We build products which have a positive impact for the world.

items.title: Social Media and Marketing Roles
items.content:
About Us


Property Master are the new Digital Mortgage Sourcing Tool for UK Landlords and we’re shaking things up in the mortgage world. Property Master is a young, dynamic fintech start up with a number of exciting partnerships in the pipeline that will provide the next step change in our market share. It provides services to landlords including acting as an online mortgage broker. While our focus is on buy-to-let mortgages we also handle residential mortgages and related insurances ’offline’.


Our online system lets the landlord key in their initial fact find, match them to a set of personalised search results which are pre-screened against all UK products and their lending criteria. No other user-friendly online system does this. Over 10,000 landlords have used Property Master to find a mortgage since its launch almost three years ago and the company holds a five-star status from Trust Pilot. 


Its business as usual for the Property Master team and with an online platform we have successfully transitioned the team to work virtually.


Job Description


We are looking for talented individuals who are furloughed to come join the Property Master team for short pieces of project activity. We are particularly on the hunt for social media and digital marketers looking for a challenge in the online mortgage space during the lockdown to help us optimise our social media channels, drive our digital marketing strategy, complete a SEO audit and help with digital communications.


Projects:



  • Complete a SEO audit

  • Optimise social media marketing opportunities

  • Optimise blog site and increase user engagement with social media content

  • Data analytics across the customer journey

  • Increasing traffic to the Property Master site leveraging PPC more effectively


 


Desired skills and experience


We have a mix of projects so not everyone will have all skill sets but overall, the skills we need are:



  • Ideally you have experience in implementing SEO best practice and developing social media content

  • Deep understanding of performance marketing channels and growth levers

  • High commercial acumen, preferably with specific online marketplace expertise

  • Strong numerical skills with ability to analyse and optimise campaigns


 


This is an excellent and exciting opportunity to work with a rapidly evolving section of the mortgage market - come and be part of the online mortgage revolution!


Job Type: Furlough- There will be full time opportunities to join our business as we grow.

items.title: Product Manager - Automated Hotel Marketplace
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Application Link: https://grnh.se/068e3b1e2us


Hello!


Thanks for checking out our job description for a Product Manager (Automated Hotel Marketplace) at Impala. We felt a little bit impersonal just throwing you right in there with words like “revolutionizing” and “disrupting”.


As such, we want you to know that the person that wrote this job description apologises in advance for any clichés, tropes or sudden-insecurity-driven-panic-attacks that you might find in the description below.


What is Impala?


Impala is making the process of booking hotel rooms ridiculously easy. We’re providing hotels with a powerful data distribution infrastructure that transforms the way hotel guests across the world browse, book, stay and pay. Think Twilio for Travel.


We launched our original API product in January 2019 and since then have grown at - quite frankly - a ridiculous old clip. Our technology is already installed in hundreds of hotels worldwide, on six continents and categorises more than 1 billion data points. This has allowed us to bring forward our ambition to revolutionise the hotel distribution market and help empower millions of people across the globe.


We are a growing remote-first team of exceptional people split across engineering, product and commercial that have built a thriving, active, supportive community.


Where is Impala going?


We’re supported by some of the best investors in the business, the early-stage backers behind Deliveroo, PillPack, SecretEscapes, Zoopla, Trivago, Monzo, Travelperk, Transferwise, Airbnb, GetYourGuide, Omio, Spotify and more! 


They’re on board because of the opportunity that lies before us - revolutionising a 1.6 trillion dollar market that’s been out-of-date for 20 years.


They also share our vision of a future in which travel is seamlessly connected and relentlessly inventive.


Our vision is that within the next two years 10% of hotel bookings worldwide will flow through Impala technology, and the product that we’re building will support the entire ecosystem of travel technology (we already have over a thousand companies signed up).


Anyone travelling anywhere will interact with products powered by Impala and to achieve this we’re growing the team extensively within the next year. Now is the most exciting time to be joining Impala as we go through a large push to scale up!


A brief overview of what you will be doing here:


Impala is on a mission to become the infrastructure that allows the Travel industry to thrive.


Today, Hotels manage their occupancy by juggling lots of booking sources supplying bookings via all kinds of means. This includes bespoke rates, overbooking volumes, compound commissions and all manner of very manual and repetitive activities.


As part of our mission to become the infrastructure that travel operates upon we want to empower Hotels to control how their rooms are sold and who sells them.


We think Hotels should be able to optimise their occupancy, to dynamically control who books their rooms, at what volume, and at what rates. They should be able to have a clear view of this and ultimately control where their bookings come from.


 


As Product Manager of Hotel Inventory Marketplace, your job will be to help Impala’s hotel partners to have the final say on how their rooms are sold and who sells them.


Currently (and ridiculously) this simply isn’t the case for millions of hotels across the world. Your job will be to help change that.


You’ll be an industry expert, someone who knows exactly where the Distribution market is going and can conjure up the right resources to answer any partner questions simply and authoritatively in an instant.


This is a totally unique PM role, heading up all of our hotel occupancy optimisation operations, helping our partners get the full picture of booking volume, guest details and rates.


On top of that, you’ll set your department goals, work cross-functionally to keep all of Impala in the loop on current partner projects and, most importantly, show hotel partners exactly how and why we can help.


You should join us if:



  • You’re that perfect blend of rational yet creative, persistent yet approachable and data-driven yet instinctive. 

  • You thrive on diving into seemingly chaotic problems and emerging with clear, actionable insight, (first of all you sound awesome, and second of all we want to meet you!)

  • You're someone who can represent the customer in our business; someone who can communicate their concerns, wants and needs in a clear, concise way to engineers and account managers alike. 

  • You can manage projects with clear set goals that help the Hotel industry advance, while also helping us meet Impala’s broader company goals. 

  • We’re looking for someone who is experienced in product development and management, has worked in collaboration with engineers, leadership being able to drive delivery, instil urgency, motivate and has been involved on a greenfield product from inception to launch. 


If this sounds like you, then we need to talk!


Where will you work?


This would be ideally a London based position, but for the right candidate we would consider remote - this means you can work from anywhere +/- 2 hours of London timezone (and less than a 3 hour flight).


We are a remote-first company, our whole engineering team is fully distributed! This was a very deliberate choice to prioritise work-life balance and ensure we’re able to accommodate the best people in Europe, whilst fostering diversity.


Please note, we only accept candidates in Western Europe because of timezone and travel time differences. We make no exceptions (we don’t have time to!). 


What you will get in return? 



  • We reward Impalans with super competitive salaries and regular reviews. Whether you're an individual contributor or you want to manage people, there's plenty of opportunity to develop your skills and boost your earning potential. We offer 3.5x the average annual raise in the UK, even if you remain within the same role.

  • We’re in the top 14% of companies in the UK for the amount of holiday that we offer, at 36 days.

  • One Unsick day off per year, to keep up with proactive health admin - so you can finally sort that trip to the dentist and get those health screens that you never have time to do.

  • Truly flexible working. With extended lunch break options, Recess Hour, and loads more.

  • We invest in your development with a generous £1,000 Professional Development budget per year, and we will support you to realise your potential. 

  • Fun and inclusive monthly social events, from go-karting to mini golf to karaoke.

  • Access to Perkbox. 

  • A super strong and proactive focus on mental and physical wellbeing. From Vitality health insurance, to Sanctus, to a monthly gym membership reimbursement, plus heaps more.

  • A generous Loved Ones Budget for remote Impalans - £750 annually to get your friends & family over to visit you once a year, no matter how near or far from home you are based. 

  • We give you a generous Personalised Workspace Budget for things like monitors, keyboards and headphones.


Sound interesting? 


If your answer is yes and you are really excited to learn more then please check out our Medium page which includes more information about who we are, what we do, what matters to us, and our culture.


Want to know more about our CEO, or want a deeper understanding of our what and why? Watch this video. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nxBZuoxCbKM


For more information about what it's like working here, check out our Glassdoor page.


Application Link: https://grnh.se/068e3b1e2us

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=9, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=28, ruby=8, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
About us: eSwapp is a platform powered by Machine Learning for colleagues to give and get skills in the workplace, such as swapping marketing skill for IT skill as an example. The global market size for Learning and Development, in which we operate, is worth £285b. Our target clients are medium to large companies within the professional services industry.


eSwapp was one of 14 UK companies selected by the British government to go on a mission to the Netherlands on Artificial Intelligence in 2019, among other achievements. We are close to securing our first round of funding and are in active discussion with several potential clients to run a pilot.


Our team has a combination of technical and commercial skills, having worked for multinational organisations such as GSK, Google, Goldman Sachs, Yale University… But most importantly, we all share the same vision to make eSwapp a global success.


We get along very well as a team and even though we all work remotely (‘current’ setup, not because of the pandemic), we interact regularly through different channels (and meeting in person, you'd usually find us at TechHub London or Google for Startups during normal time). 


So far, our focus has been on product development and securing clients through personal network, and we have a very limited presence on social media. Currently only on LinkedIn, but we plan and aim to have a proper social media launch on LinkedIn,Twitter and other appropriate channels in the next couple of months, with yourself as the key driver.


About you:

* Experience in social media and how it works within the full marketing strategy, either from brand side or client side.

* Managed and grown social media accounts through organic and/or paid campaigns, with priority given to those who have successfully grown organically, both users/followers and engagement. 

* Work part-time or full-time depending on your availability. You will work closely with CEO and Head of Creative (both with UK & international experience in marketing and advertising for blue chip companies). You will own the eSwapp brand in social media, ensuring consistent branding messages across all networks. You will devise strategy for our social media in line with our brand personality and with our full business strategy. You will also manage a Social Media intern, who's responsible for day-to-day activities.

We can offer you a fun and fulfilling remote working environment with like-minded people, new experience for you on your CV and a letter of reference after you complete your time with us and go back to your normal role. We also hope to remain friends and have a coffee with you when things normalise and establishments starts re-opening again (a proper barista coffee sitting down in a cafe, how we miss it!)


Please send your CV and application by the 30th of April. We aim to conduct skype interviews as we go along and as soon as possible after receiving and reviewing your CV.

items.title: Community Builder
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
We are looking for an enthusiastic and highly motivated community builder intern to join our growing team. If you’re an ambitious individual who wants to build a career in marketing, then we want to hear from you. Housemates is growing fast and is somewhere you can gain immediate responsibility and be able to make a real difference.


 


WHO WE ARE:


Housemates is a regulated end-to-end platform that was created when we saw the pain and uncertainty students have to go through to find accommodation. The platform allows students to book accommodation with verified landlords, sign a tenancy agreement and transfer deposits in a quick and safe transaction. For property owners, the platform allows them to list and manage properties, communicate directly with students and offers a safe and regulated environment to attract and retain student tenants.


 


KEY COMPANY MILESTONES:



  • Featured in The Times, Property Investor Today and TechNation

  • Won the regional finals of the UK's premier startup competition called The F Factor for the North West & North East

  • Accepted and participated in Ignite Accelerator Sep-Dec 2019

  • Received investment from Northstar, VC

  • Secured pre-seed funding round Feb 2020


 


We are based in Pollard Yard, just 10 minutes on the tram from Manchester Piccadilly, but due to recent events with COVID19, all employees will work remotely until the UK government makes changes to restrictions.


 


RESPONSIBILITIES:


Your responsibilities will include a range of marketing activities detailed below. However, we’d love it if there were other aspects of the business you would also like to get involved in! 


 



  • Plan, create and maintain the content calendar for Housemates UK social platforms (Twitter, Linkedin and Facebook)

  • Create and publish content for Housemates’s blog covering topics surrounding student lifestyle, new regulations happening within the property sector etc

  • Drive engagement on Housemates’s community forum across subjects such as product feedback, feature requests, company announcements etc.)

  • Research and monitor trends in behaviour within the student market 

  • Curate monthly company newsletter for both students and landlords 

  • Establish a local brand ambassador team within Manchester

  • Create competitions to promote across social platforms for the student demographic


 


REQUIREMENTS:



  • Knowledge and understanding of these social media platforms

  • Strong work ethic and ability to meet deadlines

  • Must be comfortable communicating with consumers across multiple channels 

  • A creative, great team player, willing to help where needed

  • Must have a passion for marketing


 


Please provide a cover letter with CV.


Feel free to get in touch with questions regarding this role.


-


Lydia


CEO, Housemates

At You Intrapreneur (https://www.youintrapreneur.com/ )we teach people how to become corporate entrepreneurs to advance their career within their organization or outside their organization.


We want to build the workforce of the future raising CEO alike profiles who are able to lead at every level of their company, who have a broad range of competences, and can go deep and/or broad to solve problems and build solutions. 


Our students' motto is: "you don't need to be a CEO to work as a CEO!".


We are looking for a Sales - Subject Matter Expert to build our Marketing chapter and improve our knowledge program.


Responsibilities:



  • identify critical elements to know of a Marketing function

  • identify business cases to facilitate the learning experience

  • summarize practical tips that you can share from your career experience in Marketing

  • write content material

  • work with the rest of the team to support with marketing activity (contribute to Webinars, articles, LinkedIn, etc)


What you'll have back:



  • the possibility to contribute developing future leaders and "give back" with your knowledge

  • you'll be part of a team, virtually meet other experts to expand your network

  • add a new experience on your CV and join our community of Advisers once everything goes back to normal

  • access coaching sessions for free


 


Please note this is a volunteer role for people in furlough

items.content:
Hucoco is a successful, fast growing furniture eCommerce operating in Europe. We aim to disrupt the furniture buying online experience using the latest AI technology.
We believe in starting small and launching an MVP of our site asap.
We are now putting together a core team of a UX designer, product manager, data scientist, and backend developer to reach the beta stage by the end of the year.


To lead the product team, we are looking for a talented UX designer with strong product management skills. Our company is remote-first so you will be able to work from anywhere, anytime.


The Role:



  • Research & define user needs

  • Design & prototype a product that fits those needs

  • Manage product delivery by working with the data & tech team.

  • Keep testing, researching and improving the product over time.


Your Profile:



  • You design beautiful UX/UI & you have a strong portfolio to back it up

  • Experienced in leading a product team

  • Ability to think at a high level about product strategy

  • Experience in UX disciplines such as User Research, Interaction Design

  • Ability to define & translate user needs into effective UX designs & interactions.

  • Self-motivated attitude with the ability to work in a fast-paced & autonomous work environment.


f you think you are the right fit, we would love to from you. Please send us a quick intro about yourself and a few relevant experiences/portfolio you have.

items.title: Product Designer
items.content:
We're looking for a Product Designer to join our team to help change the way the world deals with death. This is an incredible opportunity to have a real impact on people’s lives, by building products that empower them to navigate some of life’s hardest moments.


As well as working day to day in a multi-disciplinary product team, you’ll be joining a fast growing design guild. At the moment we’re two product designers, a user researcher, copywriter and marketing designer.


As a Product designer at Farewill, over the next 12 months you will:



  • Drive design projects from start to finish, working collaboratively to research, define and solve high impact customer problems

  • Contribute to the design team as a whole - pairing with other designers, up-skilling the rest of the team, or sharing feedback in crit sessions

  • Help to build out our fledgling design system, evolving existing patterns and contributing new ones wherever needed






Who you are:


You’re a designer motivated by solving tough user problems with elegant solutions. You’re driven to deeply understand users and their needs, and make thoughtful design decisions based on what you learn.


We’re looking for someone who:



  • has delivered high impact solutions, and has a portfolio to show it

  • has experience working in a multi-disciplinary product team

  • is used to working on the ‘end-to-end’ design - from initial sketches through to prototyping and working closely with developers to implement practical solutions

  • is an excellent communicator

  • is self motivated and organised






What we offer in return:



  • Competitive salary and generous stock options

  • 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays

  • £1000 and 3 days a year to spend on your personal development

  • Work from home on Wednesdays, flexible start and end to your day

  • Off-site days and team lunches

  • Santander cycles membership!

  • The chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths

  • And much more


About Farewill:
At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. Helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.


We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, Probate, in early 2019, and recently our third, Cremation.


Our growth to date has been driven by an exceptional product (see our customer reviews) and key strategic partnerships. We’ve been featured in Forbes, The Times, The Guardian and on Radio 4 among others. We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £175 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills.


Our team:
We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.


Based in our lovely office in Haggerston, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Europe - from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, JamJar and DMGT.

This is an unusual, fascinating, and emotional area to work in – if you’re up for a big challenge we’d love to meet you.


If you’d like to understand our culture and product better, here’s a few articles for you to read: About Farewill, Life at Farewill, Are you worried about your will?


Please note - In light of the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak, all Farewill employees are working remotely and we will be conducting all interviews virtually for the foreseeable future. We will continue hiring as usual.

items.content:
Role/Title: Growth Marketing Manager (Growth & Digital)


Location: London (just outside of Liverpool Street Station) / Remote


Start Date: Immediate


Quick Brief:


We are looking for an experienced, data-driven marketer who will take, develop and execute the marketing strategy of OutThink. You will own the building of sales pipeline, new business revenue growth and be ultimately responsible for creating a scalable inbound lead generation strategy that drives predictable and repeatable growth. 


We’re building a world-class Marcomms function with the ambition of reimagining cyber security enterprise SaaS marketing. You will be proving it can be creative and calculated, inspiring and effective.


You will own the OutThink brand and will be responsible for bringing it to life through strategic activities that capture the market’s attention and turn prospects into customers. Your core objective will be filling the top of the funnel and delivering pipeline to the sales team. You will be constantly experimenting, measuring and iterating with innovative growth initiatives. We move fast, so will you!


Shortlisted by CSO Magazine as “one of 12 hottest cyber security start-ups globally”, OutThink was awarded by DCMS as one of the most innovative cyber security start-ups in the UK and our product was shortlisted by Teiss as most innovative product of the year.


OutThink is a revolution, we are changing the future of cyber security.


About the Team:


 We’re a team of cyber security experts, data scientists & engineers building breakthrough technology and machine learning to identify, understand, measure and manage human risk in large global companies.


London is our company HQ and home to not only commercial team, but also our incredible product leadership team. Our HQ serves as both a commercial gateway to our customers across EMEA from where we build our base to expand across the globe.


You'll have an incredible opportunity to join a fast-growing cyber security SaaS startup in London. We have offices in London, Dubai and Barcelona and plan to expand to new geographies, so you'll get to work with international teams. To achieve our ambitious growth targets, we need an exceptional demand generation function and are looking for an entrepreneurial marketer to take a hands-on role in the first instance until it's time to further build out the team.


About The Product:


OutThink is the world's first predictive human risk intelligence platform.


With traditional approaches, such as computer-based training, videos, posters and phishing simulations failing to prevent the 90% of security breaches caused by human behaviour, there is an urgent need for a revolution to address this issue. OutThink addresses this head on by redefining security awareness training.


Our technology utilises the latest in data science to analyse subjective data collected at the point of delivering tailored security awareness training and build psychographic profiles of employees. We integrate with security systems already deployed within the organisation to further understand and monitor employee behaviour.


This allows OutThink to accurately risk score employees, giving CISOs and Security Teams the visibility required to effectively manage the risk of data breaches caused by human behaviour, by making targeted interventions. This way organisational efforts can be focused in the right area, at the right people, at the right time.


OutThink is trusted by large global companies, including FTSE 100, to deliver effective People-centric security.


The Role:


Joining a start-up is an amazing challenge, pushing well beyond the boundaries of natural growth cycles. At times you’ll move quicker than feels comfortable and be brilliant at continually re-prioritizing what must get done to keep OutThink growing at pace.


Requirements - we are looking for someone who:



  • You have 3 - 5 years experience with at least 2 years related to demand / lead generation

  • You are deeply knowledgeable of enabling and overseeing marketing automation, from start to finish

  • You are committed to a high standard of excellence and have meticulous attention to detail

  • You demonstrates outstanding communication skills, both oral and written

  • You are creative, with great critical thinking skills

  • You hold exceptional first-rate verbal and written communication skills

  • You are experienced with Hubspot / Salesforce, Drift, SEO & Google Ads.


Your day-to-day could vary greatly, some of the many things you will be working on:



  • Designing the growth marketing strategy of OutThink

  • Developing effective and creative positioning and messaging that attracts and converts prospective clients and leads into new ones

  • Translating OutThink’s growth goals into effective digital marketing strategies and campaigns

  • Driving the strategy and execution of lead nurturing programs through emails, webinars, high quality content and events

  • Managing the development and execution of all lead generation programs (e.g. paid social media advertising, SEO & Google Ads, webinars) to drive demo requests, resource requests and to optimize funnel conversion rates

  • Build content in the form of presentations, battle cards, datasheets, testimonials, and customer success stories to enable the Sales team to successfully sell OutThink

  • Build a strong relationship with the enterprise sales team by creating processes to increase sales effectiveness and velocity


Why we think you'll love it here:



  • You’ll work alongside amazing, high-performing colleagues, and have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to join an exciting start-up and grow with the company

  • We offer a competitive salary, plus equity options, with annual salary reviews

  • 23 days of paid holiday leave plus an additional 8 days off for UK public holidays

  • Extra day off for your birthday

  • A full week of work-remote a year - take your laptop and work from wherever you like!

  • OutThink Library: we'll buy and add to our library any work-relevant book you'd like to read

  • Monthly subsidy towards a discounted gym membership

  • Team breakfast on every first Friday of the month

  • Flexible working hours and working from home, subject to agreement with your line manager


Take note - the company is going through a professional re-branding, so by the end of Q1 2020 we’ll look as cool as you are!

items.content:
ABOUT


Pearl Lemon is a multiple-award winning SEO & Lead Generation Agency based in the heart of London but serving clients worldwide. With a team of 15 dotted across the UK, USA, Romania, India, Pakistan, Philippines and more they operate around the clock and communicate predominantly through Whatsapp that function more like a silicon-valley-startup and have a work-ethic comparable to investment bankers. It’s not a surprise when you consider their founder Deepak Shukla is an ex-Deloitte consultant and 30x marathon runner. 


BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH PEARL LEMON



  • Work from the office or from home

  • Flexible working hours

  • Exponential learning

  • A unique work experience being fully remote with a start-up


 


Mac Product Launch Specialist


Pearl Lemon is looking for a highly motivated and driven person to help drive forward our ambitious growth plans throughout 2020 and beyond. You will be an important part of a tight-knit team who have a hands-on approach and are passionate about taking the business to the next level.


The Product Launch Specialist (PLS) is an integral part of our technology team. Reporting directly into the Marketing Director, you will be responsible for the planning, coordination, and implementation of our product launch plans and launch plans for our developing Mac software. 


You will work closely with project teams, management and staff to ensure the necessary resources are involved in, aware of and trained on each release. You will also work closely with development, operational teams and vendors to ensure crucial information is available and communicated in various forms. You will work with marketing, training, and support to develop and execute communication, training and support plans.


There will be a focus on developing the Pearl Lemon and software brands through thought, leadership, content creation, design, research, and other steep learning-based tasks.


We are looking for someone who prides themselves on their speed of communication, attention-to-detail, and meticulous planning skills, but can adapt to change in a very fast-moving environment.


A strong understanding of digital marketing is essential, as is exceptional people and communication skills to help develop team members who you will manage directly.


 


POSSIBLE responsibilities will include:



  • Building product launch plans

  • Building contact lists

  • Compiling competitor research analysis 

  • Taking lead on developing KPIs and OKRs for the software

  • Helping optimise the software site and social media accounts

  • Helping run social media accounts and LinkedIn pages

  • Creating and implementing plans for outreach for the software


Required skills and experience:



  • Exceptional communication skills, verbal and written.

  • Being punctual and quick to respond and communicate-daily.

  • Experience with Word Press and SEO

  • Incredibly fast learner.


Benefits:



  • Learn Very Very Fast

  • Work with TedX Speakers

  • Work with ultramarathon runners, speakers of multiple languages

  • Work with a fully digital and remote team across different timezones

  • Build and grow entirely in the cloud

  • International work-cations where we meet and work in a foreign country for a week

  • Worst case - learn tons, get an amazing reference and move forward

  • Best case - go full time, build your personal brand and work from anywhere in the world

  • Take your digital skills you learn with us and apply to any job in any industry

items.title: Volunteer Content Marketing Manager
items.content:
Company overview:


MBM is an online brand. The brand was created due to an identification of a gap in the market where  the invisible barriers that ethnic minorities had to deal with in order to shine, and work three times as hard just to be seen, this was clearly apparent in corporate settings and in entrepreneurship.


In short, the online brand consists of a podcast which discusses diversity, inclusion, and aspects surrounding this, for people in both corporate and entrepreneur settings. The brand also has a paid membership and social channels, including instagram, facebook and pinterest.


Even though MBM is aimed at women of colour it is not exclusive to only this demographic.


This platform stands to empower and serve as a reason and purpose to keep growing despite your race or age.  The brand aim's to touch and change the lives of many.


Requirements



  • Experience building content strategies



  • A talented writer capable of switching tone and voice depending on the audience and message



  • Ability to write strong SEO content without sacrificing quality



  • An understanding of how to build authentic credibility through thought leadership



  • Commercially-minded with a understanding of lead generation and the importance of building relationships our audience 



  • Enjoys working in a start-up environment



  • Flexible and committed



  • Is able to think out of the box and forge new ways of making great content that has a clear business impact


Responsibilities



  • Build and manage a content strategy that positions MBM as a thought leader 



  • Optimise content to achieve SEO goals



  • Work with CEO and wider team to develop and maintain marketing goals



  • Maintain editorial governance to ensure consistency across the organisation



  • Develop and drive content marketing KPIs and ongoing optimisations that drive growth


This position is remote based, in other words, you could do this from your home.

items.title: Content Marketing Intern (SaaS Comparison)

items.content:
For immediate start - March 2020


About us


Crozdesk.com runs software marketplaces and comparison sites helping businesses globally decide on which software solutions to use. From CRM to Accounting and Marketing Automation to Supply Chain Management - we cover 250+ categories of business software and compare almost everything for our users! Our vendor solutions portal helps thousands of software companies connect with their ideal customers.


We have a dynamic team that's distributed globally with our head office based in Shoreditch, London - which is where you will be located.


If you like a collaborative and productive environment in which responsibilities are shared and where you'll come in contact with all aspects of the business, you'll fit right in.


The Internship


We are looking for a content intern with an analytical mind, a hands-on attitude and a knack for details, to join us for a 3+ months internship. You’ll be part of a small startup team, work on data-driven SEO strategy and content marketing initiatives across a wide range of industries and Software-as-a-Service categories. You will get the chance to work with partners, freelancers, users and colleagues, to produce, edit and manage the content we publish through our software comparison sites. This will involve writing and editing content to help business software buyers world-wide in their search for software. We cover 250+ categories of software (e.g. CRMs, project management solutions, etc.) - so, technical acumen and analytical thinking/writing abilities are key.


The internship is best suited for well-rounded candidates who don’t mind a challenge, are looking to learn and be part of an environment where responsibilities are shared regardless of the job title.


Requirements:


- Previous work experience B2B tech, startups or demonstrable interest in all things tech


- A Bachelor's degree or above (in progress or completed), ideally focussed on business administration, humanities or scientific subjects


- An understanding of SaaS / business software and marketplaces in general


- Experience working with large datasets (Excel, Google Sheets, etc)


- Excellent written and verbal communication skills


- Basic knowledge of SEO and web content production


- An entrepreneurial mindset and good technical acumen


Internship Salary: ~£1500 per month


Join us at Crozdesk and become part of our fast-paced, close-knit team in a flexible role with plenty of responsibilities and room for growth - either as a temporary learning opportunity or on your way to permanent employment! We look forward to your creative applications.

items.title: Content Marketing Manager
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=2, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
The shelf life of our skills is now less than 5 years so if you didn’t learn anything new for the next few years you will most definitely end irrelevant. If you’re thinking that’s kind of a big problem, you’re right! That’s why individuals need to take control of their own learning and development, and organisations need to support this because we spend most of our lives at work. 


Enter HowNow. We’re disrupting the way people learn at companies like Vodafone, GymShark, and Checkout.com with an intelligent learning platform that connects you with relevant learning resources, everywhere you already work. Feels like magic, powered by AI. 


We’re looking for a talented content marketer to be the glue that brings our content strategy together and and the creative force that makes our content stand out. We’re not looking for a position-filler. 


 


Here’s the mission, if you choose to accept it:



  • Own content from ideation to execution to distribution. We’re open to everything! 

  • Plan the content schedule, pull together the resource and drive a uniform voice across all channels. 

  • Write copy for our marketing site, create whitepapers and guides, manage our webinars, email campaigns and video content. 

  • Be an important part of a team that believes in the power of content to rebrand workplace learning. 

  • Tell powerful stories about how learning has empowered people to achieve incredible things personally and professionally. 

  • Create content that actually adds value to our customer. This is not content for content sake. 


 


Typically we find someone with the following will be a great fit:



  • At least 2 years experience as a content marketer doing a lot of the above. 

  • You must be a skilled and passionate writer with a great knack for asking the right questions. We love to see content with unique flair and tone of voice. 

  • You can be strategic, organised and get your hands dirty creating content. 

  • You know how to work SEO magic on content. 

  • You get what data to track to know if your content has been a success or not. 

  • You are always learning and striving to be better. 

  • Bonus: You’re so passionate about creating content you do it outside of work. You can also create content in different formats. You’re like a one-person agency! 


 


Here’s what we offer:



  • We invest in your wellbeing: weekly Yoga, HiiT Classes, Team Lunches and Socials. 

  • We invest in your growth. Tell us what you want to learn. We’ve got you covered with a dedicated learning budget and of course the best learning platform out there : ) 

  • A workplace and team that will inspire you to thrive and have a good laugh while we’re at it. 

  • We like to combine travel and work on “workations”. Our last one was Copenhagen! 

  • As the CEO, I’ll take personal responsibility for giving you what you need to make a success out of yourself.

items.content:
Join an ambitious team on a mission.


Game Academy is a hub for players’ personal development. 


We analyse gaming stats, identify, grow the skills and match players with real-world opportunities.


Level Up in Community management with us.


Your mission:



  • Build and support our online community

  • Help us create content to engage communities of players

  • Manage Discord, Facebook and Twitter channels and acquire new users

  • Communicate with our existing users


Your profile:



  • At least a year of experience building a community

  • Communicative personality with strong negotiation skills in a digital environment. Ability to support a discussion beyond small talk

  • User acquisition and growth hacking experience 

  • Fluency in English (both written and spoken)

  • Enthusiasm for different games and gaming communities

  • A service talent who loves to talk to people - always friendly and professional with a dedicated focus on customer satisfaction

  • Graphic design and experience in content creation is a plus


Why join us?



  • Join a highly passionate team and become a part of an international working environment

  • Get an experienced mentor

  • Shape the success story of Game Academy

  • Flexible working hours (both full-time and part-time options available)

  • Working remotely or in a coworking space in central London (post lockdown)

  • Let passion enter your daily routine!


Game Academy is an international talent tech startup that helps to unlock the potential of game players for the real world. The company is based in London and is known for gaming profile audits, career clinics, in-game challenges based curriculums to teach soft skills.


Born January 2019 as a part of the impact accelerator ZincVC, we are a team of three entrepreneurs, with an amazing advisory board, including legendary games designer, Honorary Professor Richard Bartle, veteran Sony Playstation executives and individuals instrumental to the launch of Xbox One. Experienced Community Manager Jake Mackey has kindly agreed to mentor you in the role.


Media around the world have featured our work, including the BBC, BBC3, Der Standard and IBTimes.

items.title: Fundraising Strategist
items.content:
YellowNest Education is an innovative social impact start-up designed to deliver outstanding, affordable early years education in the United Kingdom.


www.yellownesteducation.com


We are recruiting for a Fundraising Strategist for this breakthrough project. As a social impact project our impact will be deep and lasting: child development, gender diversity and better economic prosperity are three outcomes that we will facilitate.


Time commitment: estimated between 60-80 hours to be completed within 3 months of start date.


Flexible weekly hours around your schedule. 


Project Description: YellowNest is a UK based social impact start-up no development staff. The organization seeks to build a development strategy and plan that can be executed. The plan will inform YellowNest’s 2020 strategic plan and provide realistic projections for hiring development staff.


Key Deliverables:



  • Establish fundraising strategies.

  • Provide guidance on case statement / template for grant applications

  • Provide recommendations on marketing materials and campaigns directly related to development.

  • Develop a fundraising plan that includes strategic recommendations for increasing and cultivating, corporate sponsors and foundation giving; accessing workplace giving Pounds (Apprenticeship Levy); 

  • Grant seeking and writing for an emerging for-profit

  • Based on your evaluation, provide recommendations on a development staffing model.


Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Required:



  • Demonstrated successful development experience and fundraising planning

  • Business Development

  • Strategic Planning

  • Communications

  • Grant Writing

  • Individual Giving Campaigns

  • Corporate Fundraising

  • CRM systems such as Salesforce etc.


Education/Experience: fundraising and development work, experience with small boards and startups, knowledge of current fundraising trends.


Work Environment/Location: Work from home. Meet with leadership team remotely.


Visit www.yellownesteducation.com.
